gcci.text: An H100 rental price around $3.15/hour signals a post‑shortage normalization—supply chain bottlenecks have eased, allowing larger batch bookings and higher utilization—yet capex is rapidly shifting to next‑gen accelerators as enterprises lock in multi‑year leases to avoid spot scarcity.

gtpi.text: A $1.25/1M‑token input price near the DeepSeek‑family floor is accelerating an API price war that rewards lean models and high‑efficiency routing, forcing vendors to chase sparsity and distillation to maintain margins.

gagl.text: A 120 TWh annual AI load is now a material grid stressor, driving the case for firm, low‑carbon supply—modular nuclear and advanced geothermal are positioned as the credible near‑term solutions to stabilize carbon intensity.

aipi.text: Industry sentiment is cautiously bullish: falling hardware and token prices underpin sustainable growth, but the pace of capacity expansions and capex commitments raises bubble‑risk flags, making disciplined ROI the dominant theme.
